Functions.Description: The graphics view can support Mode 0 or Mode 1 graphics. Graphics can be drawn to the view with DrawCPCBitImage, DrawCPCMode0Image or DrawCPCMode1Image.
Functions.Name: CreateCPCGraphicsView
Functions.Summary: Create a graphics view for drawing CPC graphics.

Functions.Description:
A pair of colours can be specified by passing in a palette index, paper index and ink index. Palette index specifies which palette to use. The 2 colours from the palette can be chosen by specifying a paper index and ink index. These specify an index into the palette.

In the situation where there are no palettes defined, the bitmap will be drawn in black and white.

*These arguments are optional. Default values will be used if they are omitted.
Functions.Name: DrawCPCBitImage
Functions.Summary: Draw bitmap (1bpp) graphics to a graphics view.
Functions.Usage:
pixelData = GetMemPtr(0x8000)
image = CreateCPCGraphicsView(128, 128)
DrawCPCBitImage(image, pixelData, 0, 0, 16, 16, 0, 0, 1)

Functions.Description: Each pixel in the imageData is a 4 bit index. The index is used to lookup a colour from the specified palette. The palette must be a 16 colour palette othwerwise the draw call will fail.
Functions.Name: DrawCPCMode0Image
Functions.Summary: Draw a Mode 0 (4bpp) image to a graphics view.
Functions.Usage:
pixelData = GetMemPtr(0x8000)
image = CreateCPCGraphicsView(128, 128)
DrawCPCMode0Image(image, pixelData, 0, 0, 16, 16, 0)

Functions.Description: Each pixel in the imageData is a 2 bit index. The index is used to lookup a colour from the specified palette.
Functions.Name: DrawCPCMode1Image
Functions.Summary: Draw a Mode 1 (2bpp) image to a graphics view.
Functions.Usage:
pixelData = GetMemPtr(0x8000)
image = CreateCPCGraphicsView(128, 128)
DrawCPCMode1Image(image, pixelData, 0, 0, 16, 16, 0)
